meanings.definition: To remove the feathers or plumes from (an animal)
meanings.sent1: The farmer deplumed the chicken before cooking it for dinner.
meanings.sent2: The bird groomer carefully deplumed the parrot to keep its feathers healthy.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous cat deplumed the toy bird, thinking it was a real prey.
meanings.sent4: The storm deplumed the trees, leaving them bare and exposed to the elements.
meanings.sent5: The magician's trick involved depluming a live dove, astonishing the audience.
